intro: Gontscharovia, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Caucasus. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. They produce bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Gontscharovia species are often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments.
